hero.title:
Hi,
I'm Tanvir.
hero.description: A Computer Science student specializing in backend infrastructure, concurrent systems, and minimalist software architecture.

summary: I am final year undergraduate student at AIUB, deeply fascinated by how data moves through complex systems. My journey started with C++ and competitive programming, which taught me to appreciate the cost of every clock cycle.
Today, I focus on building resilient backend services and exploring the internals of databases. I believe that professional software should be as simple as possible, but no simpler.

bullets: Contributing to consensus algorithm implementations (Raft/Paxos) and networking primitives using Go.
Optimized buffer management in storage engines, reducing memory allocations by 15%.
Collaborating with global maintainers on performance-critical backend modules.
Developed benchmarks for low-latency message queues using C++20 and lock-free data structures.
Investigated cache-aware algorithms and memory-mapped file persistence strategies.
Presented findings on concurrent hashmap scaling at the undergraduate research symposium.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science & Engineering
education.description: Focus on Software Engineering & Distributed Systems. CGPA: 3.9/4.0. Relevant Coursework: Data Structures, Operating Systems, Database Management Systems.
